I found that most of my business, and I would say 95% of my business is relationships and people being introduced to me referrals. I get referrals from lenders because they know my background. They know I give good files. Weve got a good process. Its a real simple process. Somebody gets identified, whether its through a rep or somebody got a referral and they called me or whatever, get on the phone with me. Im going to ask you a series of questions about your business, general stuff. If theyre lying to me, once I see the financials, Im going to see it real quick. So I then give them offers, options that are available to them in their industry or specific, or I tell them right then and theres no, I dont have any programs for them. So its a real quick, easy type thing. Its probably a half hour conversation. If theyre interested, then I follow up and I say, okay, I explain the process to them. And then I say, Im going to need a series of documentation. And boom. Then I send them out an email list out what documents I need, applications, whatever it may be, financials, tax returns, whatever it may be. And they send it to me. And I keep everything. Nobody on the team has access to it but me. Its all in my Google drives, so Im the admin over it. And then once that happens, I then identify the best programs I have for them and I go down. If one doesnt work, I go to the next one, but I dont canvas and just send it out. Thats what a lot of those morons in that product I told you about do. And it kills a credit, it kills clients credit. Thats our process. And its real simple. Its real simple and it works. And Im making good money. I want to make it easier, streamlined, and Id love to get rid of reps because reps waste a lot of my time.
Yeah, no.

It depends, because you got to remember who Im dealing with on a client. Right. So Im not dealing with like a brick and mortar type shop. Im not dealing with pizza places. My thought process was, okay, well, how do you leverage AI to identify people that are searching for it? So what do I mean by that? Theres firms out there, like salesforce, for example, where theyre using AI in their CRMs to generate other clients and seeing and then theres ways where you could see in the web where people are searching for certain things. So, like, if somebody typed in in Google or even in AI or Chat, GBT, whatever, receivable financing. Theyre looking for something. So how do you got to drill into the people looking for it rather than just do a broad canvassing? Does that make sense? Yeah. So thats why I suspect Ive had a lot of different marketing firms that Ive used. And I used to have cold callers years ago when I had my office up in New Jersey. It generally didnt work. It generally didnt work because sea level executives dont want to be bothered with cold calls.
